sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russia fills its Red Square with troops, tanks and intercontinental missiles to mark Victory Day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Putin defends his war in Ukraine, saying the danger is rising by the day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And here in Odessa, southern Ukraine, Russia's war continues to have a devastating impact on the city's infrastructure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Also in the program, desperately seeking support. We'll look ahead to the highly symbolic meeting between the French and German leaders to discuss energy and defense.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russia's been marking its World War II victory over Nazi Germany, a fight President Vladimir

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Putin has likened to Russia's so-called special operation in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Speaking at a military parade in Moscow to celebrate the Red Army's campaign, Vladimir Putin sent the troops for fighting for Russia's security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Earlier, I spoke with our correspondent Galina Polonskaya about the growing significance in Russia of the parade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Galina, eight years ago, we saw Vladimir Putin use Victory Day to stake a claim in Crimea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He was expected to make similar comments about Ukraine, but he didn't.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Tell us more about what he did have to say. Hello, talks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Well, actually, today Vladimir Putin explained to the Russian people that his decision on Ukraine was inevitable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He said that, quote, Russia gave a preemptive rebuff to aggression it was a forced timely and only right decision so those who were watching the putin's speech this parade had to believe that russia did not have any other choice was putin reminded that russia asked the west for the security guarantees but said that nato countries did not want to hear about that and um actually talks during the whole speech vladimir putin was drawing parallels between what the russian armed forces are doing right now in ukraine and the second world war which is called the great patriotic War in Russia he said for example quote today you are defending what fathers grandfathers grand grandfathers fought for and he addressed Russia's armed forces and the Donbass forces saying that you are fighting for their motherland for its future so that no one forgets the lessons of the Second World War he also stressed that those who fought in Ukraine weres the lessons of the Second World War. He also stressed that those who fought in Ukraine were among the participants of this parade and promised help to those families whose members were killed in Ukraine. Galina, we know Victory Day is a national holiday, of course, but just how important is it in ordinary people's lives? Because in recent years it seems to have an increasing military significance exactly talks this holiday is extremely important for I will say maybe most of the people in Russia as all of them have someone a member of the family or another like far away relative or a friend who took part in the second world war so this is in history a very tragic history for most of russians and in the recent years they are used to this military showcase of russia's might on this Victory Day. And let's say it's not shocking for most as many remember how it was in the Soviet times and what they are seeing right now is maybe a matter even of pride in some case. The question is really right now, Toks, is how many do realize that there is a totally different history which has been drawn by the state with the help of such important and very powerful tools as the state TV which is broadcasting this parade across all the time zones in Russia. This is a question that nobody can really answer at this point.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: While Russia held its annual victory parade in Moscow, the Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky opted to release a video.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In it, he walks down a Kiev street where in normal times a parade would be held.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He said he has no doubt Ukraine will win its war with Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Today we celebrate the day of victory over Nazism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And we will not give anyone a single piece of our history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We are proud of our ancestors, who, together with the other nations in the anti-Hitler coalition, defeated Nazism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And we will not allow anyone to annex this victory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We will not allow it to be appropriated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: By anyone he means Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Kremlin has tried to justify its invasion by blaming it on the West, telling Russians they're once again fighting Nazism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Nazis were expelled from Yalta, Simferopol, Kerch and the entire Crimea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Mariupol was liberated from the Nazis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They expelled the Nazis from all over Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But the cities I named are especially inspiring for us today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They give us faith that we will drive the occupiers out of our land for sure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Zelenskyy signs off saying happy victory over Nazism Day and glory to Ukraine. Ukraine is calling for sustained financial support from its richest allies as Russia's war rages on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: President Volodymyr Zelensky addressed the G7 group on Sunday, alongside a surprise visitor, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: As long as the war continues, we need 5 to 7 billion US dollars a month in support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: When the war is over, we'll have to rebuild everything destroyed by Russia from a sum exceeding 600 billion dollars.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This is a lot for our state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This is not possible for Ukraine, but this is possible for you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Zelensky also backed a newly developed package of sanctions that would further tighten restrictions on Russian imports and exports, and criticised Hungary for looking to impede the economic punishment of Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Leaders from the Group of Seven developed democracies say the actions of President Vladimir Putin have brought shame on Russia. Casting a look back at World War II, they stressed in unity that Putin must not win. Pledging to phase out or ban the import of Russian oil, they also called for an end to Russia's blockade of Ukrainian food production and exports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We've just heard that call there from the Ukrainian president

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: for more support from the G7 group of countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Let's hear the thoughts now of Peter Dickinson.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He's Ukraine editor at the Atlantic Council.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Thanks again for taking time to speak to us here on the programme.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Volodymyr Zelensky making clear he needs more financial support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Where is this money going to go?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Good morning. Thank you for having me. Well, a lot of the money is needed simply to keep the Ukrainian economy afloat. The country's economy has been absolutely devastated by the last 10 weeks of warfare since the Russian invasion began in February, many, many businesses, of course, have closed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And the country's exports, the country that has a heavily export-dependent economy, particularly in metals, commodities and agriculture, has been blockaded. The southern ports, primarily Odessa, which are the gateways of Ukraine for Ukrainian trade to the international markets, have been blockaded by the Russian Navy since February. So the country is essentially in economic sense under siege. So Ukraine desperately needs funding in order to keep the country afloat and to keep basic services in place, to have payments for municipal workers, social payments for people, et cetera.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Of course, then on top of that, you have the enormous rebuilding costs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Kyiv says a move by authorities in Germany to prevent the Ukrainian flag being unfurled

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: at a World War II memorial service to mark V-E Day was a slap in the face for the Ukrainian people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Police in Berlin confiscated at least one large banner after officials in Germany said neither Russian nor Ukrainian flags were to be allowed to ensure commemorations remained peaceful.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But Ukraine's foreign minister accused Berlin of making a mistake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He said it was deeply false to treat Ukrainian and Russian symbols equally.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He added that taking a Ukrainian flag away from peaceful protesters was an attack on everyone defending Europe and Germany from Russian aggression.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Earlier there were rival demonstrations in the German city of Cologne in support of Russia or Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Around a thousand people gathered to protest against arms deliveries to Kyiv, some showing solidarity with Russian President Vladimir Putin, others simply opposed to war or arms shipments to Ukraine. However, a pro-Ukraine demonstration attracted significantly more participants, although it fell short of the expected 10,000. Police were deployed to prevent clashes between the two groups. Relations between Germany and Kyiv have been strained by the war in Ukraine, with some in Kyiv arguing that Berlin has not done enough to support them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: If you want to know more about Russia's Victory Day and why it matters, then do check out this story on our website, euronews.com. Time for us to take a break right now on the programme. We'll be back in a few moments.
